review: titan quest 2 is off to a fantastic start its a beautiful and compelling action rpg that honors its roots while building a new legend if youre a fan of the original or looking for a classic handcrafted adventure and dont mind the inevitable early access rough edges its well worth diving in now for those seeking a fully polished contentcomplete experience wait until the fates have finished weaving its destiny
it makes a solid first impression the pathfinding of enemies could be better i play on linux and i had only one crash so its fine
feels like classic tq but with a more cleverly designed mastery system
i had a great time while taking my time  probably 14 hours of actual adventuring while fully exploring maps  cant wait for more  this review is from the initial early access content

excellent start so far altho theres only a small amount of content compared to what well eventually get its already a really fun game because the foundational elements are so high quality build variety looks really promising production value and the story so far are excellent and overall its just a really solid package i binged my way through the first act and i cant wait for more
needs more content and some mastery and progression tuning but this is a very promising game im glad they lived up to the expectations my childhood self had from tq 1
2 thumbs up for the early access
710 game worth every dime great graphics awesome combat and all around fun and challenging

i wasnt expecting to like this game so much but having tons more fun in this wayyyy early access game than i did in d4 poe2 and le  they got a potential arpg gem here if they continue to improve and add content  it doesnt reinvent the wheel you dont need to theory craft into guides and spreadsheet oblivion to minmax etc  the simplicity and straight forwardness is actually refreshing  can wait for future big updates and full release
great fun so far nice graphics abundance of possible builds great soundtrack

i think the game is great its all about story  great game play  they take what works from other arpgs and keep it simple  id argue the top reason to play the game is the setting just like assassins creed odyssey  anyways there is a lot of content for early access it wore me out after a few hours    the game is fun and intuitive which is great for casual gamers  hardcore gamers will probably not care too much about this and will stick with poe2
the game has great potential
